page.title: 02Hexham_in the beginning.
page.content: In 681, Hexham was known as {Hagustaldes-ea,}the Water near the home of the Younger Son who had not inherited any of the family land.The Normans changed the Saxon name to {Hexham,}the town on the Hextol river, which is now called Cockshawburn.In 674,{Queen Ethelreda}gave some land in Hexham to{Wilfrid}to build a church. He built the first church where the Abbey is today, and the Saxon crypt is still there.This became a monastery and was granted sanctuary one mile from every direction.Land to the south was the property of the Royal family of Northumbria,and became known as{Hexhamshire,}a lovely area of rolling farmland, villages and woods.Hexham grew around the Abbey, and has had an interesting and, at times,a troubled history.
